Class Java1

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
java1.Java1
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, ComponentListener, KeyListener, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener, Accessible, RootPaneContainer, WindowConstants
public abstract class Java1 extends JFrame implements ActionListener, KeyListener, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, ComponentListener

    Java1.Turtle

      protected void fillTriangle(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int x3, int y3, Color color)
      Draws a triangle filled by the specified color this function doesn't care which order the points are passed in
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x value of the first point
      y1 - the y value of the first point
      x2 - the x value of the second point
      y2 - the y value of the second point
      x3 - the x value of the third point
      y3 - the y value of the third point
      color - the color of the triangle

      y1 - the y value of the first point
      x2 - the x value of the second point
      y2 - the y value of the second point

    • drawImage

      protected void drawImage(String pathname, int x, int y) throws IOException
      Draws image to screen given a path name, first checks to see if the image is loaded, and if not loads it into memory before printing
      Parameters:
      pathname - path to image file
      x - the x value of the top left point
      y - the y value of the top left point
      Throws:
      IOException

      y - the y value of the top left point

    • text

      protected void text(String text, int x, int y, Color color)
      Writes the given text to screen with the given colour and the given position
      Parameters:
      text - the text to write to the screen
      x - the x coordinate for the top left corner of the text
      y - the y coordinate for the top left corner of the text
      color - the color of the text

    • text180

      protected void text180(String text, int x, int y, Color color)
      Writes the given text to screen, but rotated 180 degress has the given colour and position, but the x and y values are in the top right instead of the top left
      Parameters:
      text - the text to write to the screen
      x - the x coordinate for the top right corner of the text
      y - the y coordinate for the top left corner of the text
      color - the color of the text

      protected void clear()
      Clears the screen, filling it with the current Background colour the background colour can be changed with setBackGround

    • setDelay

      protected void setDelay(int delay)
      Sets the refresh rate, or how long the program takes between every screen draw
      Parameters:
      delay - the amount of time in ms to wait between every frame

      Stops all graphics updates

    • init

      protected void init()
      initialization function that's used in the constructor this sets up the object.

    • loop

      protected abstract void loop()
      Update function for the object, this function is run every frame the delay value determines the maximum time between frames, and this value can be changed with setDelay() loop() is run every time an event is triggered
      See Also:
      • setDelay(int)

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
      runs the loop figure whenever an event triggers. the timer constantly runnign triggers this event, giving us a stable framerate
      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener
